issues.•Continuously evaluate Firm’s use of technology and internal processes, and evaluate for possible improvements.•Manage and perform testing for Firm applications – initial, ongoing, and upgrade related.•Manage application product lifecycle and plan for changes.•Provide escalation support to the Help Desk.•Provide after-hours second level support to the Help Desk and/or users as part of engineering escalation rotation.•Provide support for other Data Systems Analysts for projects and tasks completion.•Provision and decommission Active Directory and/or Exchange accounts and groups.•Manage and maintain Active Directory environment.•Deploy and integrate new applications and systems to both local and remote systems.•Address Microsoft Windows updates and other security vulnerabilities, and adhere to a strict patching schedule.•Develop and maintain documentation related to responsibilities.•Manage and perform quality control testing practices and procedures for Firm applications to provide and maintain a reliable working environment.•Develop, maintain, and manage relationships with vendors and consultants related to Firm’s technologies.•Lead the evaluation and decision-making process for Firm technologies.•Own and lead Firm-wide projects with little supervision.•Mentor and support the development of teammates.•Assist with creation of training materials for Firm applications.•Perform other duties as assigned.Possess superior understanding, and demonstrate the highest level of expertise with one or more of the following:•Microsoft Windows 10 desktop operating systems.•All Microsoft Office 365 technologies including SharePoint Online, Exchange Online, OneDrive, Dynamics, Planner, and Intune.•Azure and Azure AD technologies.•Citrix and other remote technologies.•Microsoft Exchange 2016 and above.•Microsoft SQL Server 2014 and above (Clustering and DBA experience a plus).•Windows server operating system (Windows Server 2012 and above).•Microsoft Office Suite (Office Suite 2016 and above).•iManage Worksite (Versions 9.x, 10.x, and Cloud).•Litigation Support Applications (Concordance, CaseMap, Relativity, CaseNotebook, Trial Director).•Cloud collaboration technologies (Box, Microsoft, Google, RingCentral).•Accounting applications (Elite 3E).•Application packaging and deployment systems (SCCM Current Branch, Admin Studio, MSI Packager).•Metadata management software (Metadact-e, Workshare).•RingCentral Communication Systems.•Microsoft IIS Server.

title: Customer Service Rep-Biometric Tech ON CALL
description_text: Description ASRC Primus is seeking an On Call Customer Service Specialist -Biometrics Technician in support of our on-going programs at the US Citizen Immigration Service.  This role is perfect for a college student who is free during daytime M-F hours or a stay at home parent or other who has the flexibility to come into the office as needed with little advanced notice. This position will not have a steady, fixed number of hours per week. It will instead be occasional requests for all call support to cover hours for vacationing or sick employees and for added support at the site when surges of appointments are expected.  Key Role: Help applicants through the US Citizenship application process. Provide excellent customer service interface and initiate the completion of forms related to the US Immigration biometrics application processes. Take digital/manual biometrics such as finger prints, initiation and processing of database ID and quality checks, and reconciliation of interim documentation. Use databases to search/enter data to capture electronic/manual biometrics information. This position is a front-line, customer service position that requires great people skills. Provide flexible, open, and responsive support to procedural changes within the department and participate in implementing and testing new technology and standard operating procedures.   ASRC Federal and its Subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, gender, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, national origin, religion, marital status, ancestry, citizenship, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor prohibited by applicable law   Basic Qualifications:  *US Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a government security clearance A MUST *Willingness to work an on call, as needed schedule required *Prior customer service or administrative experience. *Experience entering and retrieving data into a database required *HS Diploma  Additional Qualifications:  *Ability to speak a second language in addition to English is a plus but not required. *Experience with MS Office and other computer based skills is a plus Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

title: Field Service Technician - Southern California
description_text:
DescriptionField Service Technician 

Region -  Southern California

**Use of personal vehicle required**

Be part of the advancing innovation and sustainable transit solutions in the California region. Work as an Electrical Field Service Technician for an international transit manufacturer and parts distributor. Field Service Technician Qualifications:2+ years of experience in either electrical, HVAC or other related fieldThorough knowledge of 12V and 24V, 600 V and air conditioning systemsIntermediate computer skills and knowledge of multi-plex systems.Ability to work from blueprints, process sheets, schematics, and instructions as requiredElectrical troubleshooting skills and experienceExperience with electrical wiring, circuit testing, troubleshooting and general repairSolid customer service skillsPLC and ladder logic experience preferredHigh voltage experience and hydrogen training or certification preferredGeneral knowledge of transit bus/hybrid and/or electric drive systems ideal but not necessary

Pay rate:  $ 22.00 - $33.00 per hour depending on experience

title: Senior eCommerce Manager (for multiple marketplaces)
description_text: DescriptionDel Decus Enterprises is a pioneer in the European natural cosmetics online market. Sustainability, responsibly for our customers as well as the excellent quality of our products are key pillars of our corporate culture.Working at Del Decus Enterprises means joining a dynamic and stimulating team, taking up new challenges every day, being inspired by our philosophy and values, doing your bit to help us bring more excellence to our customers.We are offering an hourly rate wage, flexible work hours and a possibility to work from any place in the world.We are looking for a team member who is excited to work in a fast-paced environment, flexible, easy-going, team-oriented, focused, result-driven, technology-savvy, curious by nature and eager to learn. Are you willing to leave your impact on the company as well as the whole development of the cosmetics industry? Sounds like you? - Join our fast-growing team!You will:Lead e-commerce strategy development and deployment, being a right hand of the CEO  Coordination and development of all e-commerce projects,including the expansion to new countries and other marketplaces, collaboration with the marketing teamExpand digital sales across EMEA, NA and AP including sales via various marketplacesManaging all our marketplaces for optimal performance and profitabilityExecute and evolve merchandising and marketing strategies, implementation of e-commerce standards as well as manage the eCommerce product launch processSuggest new ways to grow the digital business including site enhancements and optimisation of listings on Amazon, eBay as well as on other marketplacesImplementation, analysis and evaluation of relevant performance indicators and derivation of action measures at product, price and inventory level Be responsible for e-commerce site analytics to drive growth for e-commerce KPIsBring in your ideas and improvements to actively contribute to the company's success. You will never hear "…because we always did it like that" again Your Profile:4+ years of experience in eCommerce environment, ideally in the marketplace business as well as managing and optimizing e-commerce sitesUnderstanding of Amazon search engine algorithmsStrong managerial experience, ability to lead a project, allocate resources and expand new marketplacesHaving entrepreneurial mindset and ready to dive into the uncharted territories of growing an early-stage brandExcellent written and verbal communication skills in English, German is considered as a plusExperience in managing and optimizing e-commerce sitesYou are resourceful and have a strong ability to operate independently with strong time management and analytical mindsetYou are reliable and stick to your word and do whatever it takes to follow-throughYou resonate with our mission and have a genuine interest in tech and softwareYou view problems and challenges analytically, as opportunities to learn and growYou are more interested in the "why?" than the "what?" because you want to solve the root issue rather than put a band-aid over itAmazon eCommerce certification is a plus (ATES)What you can expect from us: Possibility to work from any place in the worldFlexible work hoursCompetitive hourly rate Opportunity to make an impact in a fast growing startupResponsibility over exciting and challenging projects that have a direct, visible impact on our customers and the industryPrompt takeover of self-responsibilityVery positive work environment in a young, international, and motivated team

description_text: DescriptionJob SummaryA Team Staffing, Southern California's locally-based staffing firm specializing in the title, escrow, mortgage and real estate industries, has an immediate opening for an Office Administrator/Marketing Coordinator with a real estate brokerage office in Beverly Hills, CA.The Office Administrator / Marketing Coordinator plays a valuable role in supporting the firm's agents and servicing the firm's clients. This dynamic real estate office needs a strong administrative professional to support the top producing real estate agents and assistants, and to maintain and support the office operations. This position offers an office professional or recent grad with 1-3 years of experience and familiarity with the real estate industry a unique opportunity to apply marketing and organizational skills to gain diverse, hands-on experience in a positive and highly professional culture..A Team Staffing offers competitive pay from the first day on the job. A team member who continues their career can become eligible for medical insurance, sick days, paid holidays and participate in the 401K plan.Responsibilities and DutiesCoordinating meetings, schedules, calendars and client eventsProviding exceptional customer service to clients, vendors and colleaguesAssisting with office administrative duties including preparing marketing flyers, open house listing materials, supporting agents with technical computer issues, and tracking agent expenses and marketing budgets.Managing and updating client database, tracking systems, and reportsAssisting Management Team with any and all other projects and tasks, as neededQualifications and Skills1-3 years of experience in an admin or coordinating role in a professional office; legal, title, escrow, mortgage, insurance, real estate related experience preferred.Tech savvy; strong Word and Excel skills, working knowledge of Adobe software including Illustrator, Mac experienceSocial media savvy, with good working knowledge of professional use of LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and other platformsProven writing, proof reading and grammar skills a must.Must be detail-oriented and able to create and maintain files, images, flyers, spreadsheet reports, in a variety of software programs.Able to manage multiple projects and priorities to meet deadlines in a fast paced environmentStrong written and verbal communication skillsHighly organizedDemonstrated success in a support role delivering above and beyond client serviceMust be accountable and resourceful with a can do attitudeAdditional InformationA Team Staffing is Southern California's title, escrow, mortgage and real estate staffing specialist, providing direct, temp to hire and temporary positions to talented and qualified candidates throughout the region. For SEVENTEEN years, we have spent our days building relationships with Southern California’s leading title, escrow, mortgage and real estate employers.We aim to advance our employee's careers in the real estate industry and to provide them with valuable opportunities to build skills, gain experience and achieve career and financial success.

title: STD HIV Counselor #720191
description_text: DescriptionPosition: STD/HIV Counselor #720191Program: Community Health ProgramsDepartment: Health ServicesReports to: Program ManagerCompensation: $15.00 per hourStatus: 100%, Full-Time, Non-Exempt, UnionSchedule: Monday-Friday 10am-7pmProbation: 90 daysBenefits: Medical, Dental, Vision; also including Life Insurance, Long-Term Disability, Employee Assistance Program, and a 403(b) Retirement Plan Center’s Mission:Building a world where LGBT people thrive as healthy, equal, and complete members of society.We value:Respect ~ Excellence ~ Inclusiveness ~ Innovation ~ Integrity DEPARTMENT SUMMARY: As the nation’s largest and most experienced provider of LGBT medical and mental health services, we help LGBTQ people lead healthier, happier lives, by keeping their minds and body well. All services are free or low cost. We’re also one of the few Federally Qualified Health Centers in the nation with providers who specialize in primary care for LGBTQ people and with a research team working to advance the care and treatment of people in our community. JOB SUMMARY: Under the supervision of the Program Manager, provide HIV and STD testing; triage HIV-positive patients into medical care; coordinate, schedule, and conduct outreach events to specifically target gay and bisexual men and transgender clients of color; and create and sustain working relationships with businesses and community members where outreaches will be conducted.  ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:1) Provide HIV and STD counseling, testing, outreach, and education for the Sexual Health Program (SHP) at Los Angeles LGBT Center (LALGBTC) as well as other designated off-site locations including the Spot;2) Accurately complete risk assessment forms, lab requisitions, and additional written materials;3) Assist in data entry and preparation of reports;4) Collect and collate oral, blood, and urine specimens;5) Assist in the preparation of test results;6) Provide phlebotomy services for HIV, syphilis and hepatitis testing;7) Follow universal safety precautions at all times;8) Provide and maintain a customer service atmosphere which incorporates the standards and protocols of the SHP and LALGBTC;9) Provide pre and post-test health education and counseling regarding HIV/STD infection, transmission, prevention and testing;10) Assist in facilitation of client flow and coordination of all clients;11) Maintain accurate logs regarding client tests, confirmatory results, and missing results;12) Assist in the development and implementation of outreach programs;13) Participate in staff meetings and other meetings as needed;14) Provide post disclosure follow-up when necessary;15) Triage HIV positive clients to the Jeffrey Goodman Clinic and other community resources and referrals;16) Schedule appointments for clients needing additional referrals and services;17) Coordinate obtaining missing results with Public Health Lab and Jeffrey Goodman Clinic Lab;18) Contact clients who have not obtained their results;19) Able to work in a high-volume fast pace environment;20) Must be able to adapt to new testing technologies and procedures;21) Other duties as assigned;JOB QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE: 1) Knowledge of or experience working with the LGBTQ community and familiarity with issues of particular relevance to LGBTQ people;2) A passion for the Center’s work and its mission to make the world a better place for LGBTQ people;3) Minimum of 1-year experience (paid or volunteer in HIV education or counseling);4) Extensive knowledge of HIV/STD infection, transmission and prevention; knowledge of community resources and referrals;5) Bilingual skills, a plus (English/Spanish fluency preferred);6) Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including strong interpersonal and organizational skills;7) Strong computer skills and knowledge including word processing, database operations, spreadsheets, and other software systems;8) Must be able to navigate client database and email system;9) Be knowledgeable of community resources and referrals for HIV/STDs, mental health, case management, and additional appropriate client-centered referrals;10) Experience working with the LGBTQ community and familiarity with issues of particular relevance to LGBTQ people;11) Have a passion for the Center’s work and its mission to make the world a better place for LGBTQ people;12) State certified HIV pre/posttest counselor, completion of Basic I and Basic II;13) State certified in venipuncture/blood withdrawal;14) Certified in Partner Counseling and Referral Services;15) Education or intensive background in Psychology, Social Work, Sociology or related field a plus;16) Demonstrated ability to work effectively with people of diverse races, ethnicities, nationalities, sexual orientations, gender identities, gender expression, socio-economic backgrounds, religions, ages, English-speaking abilities, immigration status, and physical abilities in a multicultural environment. The Los Angeles LGBT Center is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to fostering diversity within its staff. Applications are encouraged from all persons regardless of their race, color, ancestry, religious creed, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, medical/physical/mental condition, pregnancy/childbirth and related medical condition, age, marital status, or veteran status.

title: Safety Specialist/Auditor
description_text: DescriptionSuperior Grocers, a leading independent grocery chain, is looking for a temporary Safety Auditor (Field Position)! Safety Auditor (Temporary Position)Position Summary: Responsible for on-going store safety inspections to assure OSHA compliance and recommendations for the reduction of frequency and severity of work related incidents.  The Safety Auditor is responsible for ongoing communication with store management to maintaining a safe working environment for all Superior employees. This may include but is not limited to assessments, trainings, program recommendations, safety tools and equipment assessments, job safety analysis and other projects as assigned.  Proposing ideas and programs to create and maintain a safe and healthy work environment.  Is an integral team member of the Field Safety Auditor(s), supervisor and other corporate safety and workers compensation team.   Roles & Responsibilities ·         Conducts store audits to assure OSHA compliance on an on-going basis·         Reviews audits with store management ·         Reviews audits with Corporate safety staff ·         Makes recommendations for safety related disciplinary actions as appropriate·         Provides recommendations and proposals to reduce incidents based on inspection results·         Prepares and submits audits and other projects as needed ·         Reviews incident trends with corporate staff and provide recommendations and solutions·         Maintains on-going communication with title: Traveling Customer Success Specialist
description_text: DescriptionReynolds and Reynolds, one of the top providers of premium integrated computer solutions for automobile dealerships, is seeking Traveling Customer Success Specialists to join our growing team of professionals. The position is primarily focused on providing on-site consulting support to approximately 50-70 automotive dealerships within an assigned region. As a Traveling Customer Success Specialist, you will be responsible for providing high level customer support at the automotive dealership location. Functioning as a consultant, you will be responsible for providing excellent support for our products and ensuring that our customers are using the software that they purchased to their full potential. Traveling Customer Success Specialists work from a home office and will be provided a company car, iPhone, tablet, and printer/scanner equipment.Requirements:Ability to travel between 10-20% of the time overnight depending on assigned territoryBachelor’s DegreeMust be a self-starter with good time management skillsStrong written and verbal communication skillsExcellent customer service and organizational skillsAbility to build strong customer relationshipsTraining:Paid Training! This role will begin with an intensive five (5) month paid training program located at our office in Houston, TX. Trainees living outside of Houston, TX will be provided a furnished corporate apartment during the training period. Training for this role will consist of classroom instruction and online courses that provide in-depth product training as well as automotive industry knowledge.  In addition, you will be paired with mentors across the country where you can apply your classroom knowledge in a real-world setting.

title: Project Engineer
description_text: DescriptionPerforms tasks related to the collection of cost data required to monitor project budget and estimates.  Requires the selection and application of resource monitoring and control principles, techniques and technical knowledge of construction project.Meets with engineering team to review production schedule and confirm all materials, equipment and resources are readily available for production to continue on schedule and within budget.Reviews shop drawings, design specifications, material requirements and project data to ensure quality and contract specification compliance.Provides technical input for project work plan and scheduling. Identifying risk elements of production, materials, equipment or process that could negatively impact the budget or schedule.Evaluates weekly and monthly production, schedule and budget projections to accurately track project performance. Documents daily activities in Company approved methods and technologies.Updates project schedule weekly for owner and management reporting. Attends weekly owner meetings; presents on project production status as needed. Prepares and manages a three-week work plan. Notifies engineering and project management of any significant schedule changes and develops solutions to mitigate delays and cost.Initiates and manages all Requests for Information (RFIs), as needed by project.Remits accurate project quantities using assigned project cost coding to ensure project financials are accurately reported. Manages invoicing with Company accounting team regarding materials, equipment and subcontractor needs.Supports engineering team with quality assurance as needed. Reviews certificates and permits needed to perform work. Participates in all worksite tours with leadership or external parties. Reviews required Job Hazard Analysis (JHAs) to ensure a safe and compliance work environment for all construction personnel. Participates in all weekly safety meetings with field team and project leadership; presents field analysis as needed.Assists the estimating team with project schedule, budget and cost parameters by providing technical input as needed.Assists the development of design drawings and provides technical input, as needed.Coordinates subcontractor work methods, schedule and crews as needed.Perform project leadership role during close-out procedures if Project Manager separates from project before close. Reviews close-out checklist with owner and field crews at the end of the project.Maintains knowledge of Company values and strategic plan.Perform additional assignments per management’s direction.Bachelor's Degree in a related field required.7+ years construction engineering experience required.Experience managing construction engineering teams required.Proven skill and ability managing engineering teams in a design build or other alternative build project.Able to identify and implement growth opportunities in direct reports to build talent development within project team.Advanced planning and scheduling skills required.Able to drive direct reports and influence non-reporting teams towards a common deliverable.Able to set clear expectations for direct reports regarding role and responsibilities.Able to delegate and assign work to engineering team to progress the project production forward.Able to manage multiple engineering tasks and progress them all towards a common goal.Advanced knowledge of contract specifications and quality assurance practices.Able to identify budget and project costs and recommend options to mitigate project delays.Strong verbal, written and presentation skills.Knowledge of design build and other alternative build techniques.Knowledge of financial reporting methods, quantity tracking methods and cost coding.Knowledge of construction scheduling and production time management preferred.Ability to assume responsibility, interface and communicate effectively with others.Some of the benefits you may be eligible for as an employee are:Comprehensive compensation package and paid time off programIndustry leading 401(k)/RRSPMedical/Extended Health Care, Dental, Vison and/or Provincial MedicalWellness benefits & Employee Assistance ProgramTuition Reimbursement ProgramWe are an EEO/AA/ADA/Veterans employer.

title: Surgery Center Nurse Director RN
description_text: DescriptionAn ASC Ambulatory Surgery Centerin the greater LosAngeles region of Southern California is seeking a seasonedhealthcareleader to join their team as Nurse Director Ambulatory Surgery Center.The RN Nurse Director Ambulatory Surgery Center will be responsible for the clinical operations of the surgery center. It will be the duty of the Nurse Director to communicate effectively with Physicians, Nurses, Allied Health Professionals andHealthcareExecutives alike to ensure that the facility runs according to policies and procedures. Additionally, they will assist the Administrator in managing the fiscal operations, employee relations as well as regulatory compliance within the Surgery Center.This Ambulatory Surgery Center is a member of a large surgical group which values quality and aims to provide the best possible care to the patients they serve. Together, they are committed to using the latest advanced technology and evidence based medicine to provide top of the line services.Thismulti-specialty Ambulatory Surgery Center houses 4ORsoperating rooms and 10preop/PACUbays. They will be performing a number of surgeries including: General,GYN, Podiatry, Pain Management and Orthopedic Surgery.The Ambulatory Surgery Center is located in a beautiful region of Southern California. TheASCAdministrator will enjoy living just a short distance away from both the beach as well as populated urban cities. This location offers a wide variety of amenities and activities to choose from. There are a number of affordable housing options within the region.The Surgery Center is looking for a dedicated team-player to join them as RN Nurse Director. A competitive salary and suite of benefits will be offered to compliment this amazing leadership opportunity.monsterboost9999

title: Entry Level Sales Reps - Work from Home  $21.00 Base Pay Per Appt.
description_text: DescriptionEntry Level Sales Reps - Work from HomeVector Marketing is running virtual interviews for sales rep positions, start work within the week! Basic responsibilities include working with customers virtually, explaining our American made products, and placing any orders. There is a great starting base pay (paid weekly) that isn’t based on sales or results, but incentives are possible based on performance.We work with Cutco products that are used in the home focusing on the kitchen and some gardening tools as well. Previous experience & knowledge about home goods isn’t needed. We provide all of the tools and training needed for success. Interview and work from home.Position Details:Excellent pay – great base pay not based on sales, paid weekly. We have a commission structure set up based on performance. There is opportunity to make more, but there is still a fall back for the sales rep to make an income even if they have an off week.Solid training – we’ve been training people to do well for over 40 years. Even if someone doesn’t decide to stay with us long term, the sales, networking, & communication skills they build are needed for any field.Flexible scheduling – we help our reps create a schedule that works best for them. Some work as much as possible, some work for just the summer, while others choose to be super part time around other commitments such as other jobs or family obligations.Choice of location – sales reps have an opportunity to interview, train, and work from home.Basic Requirements:Enjoy working with peopleAll ages eighteen plus or seventeen and a HS GraduateConditions applyAble to start within the next 7 – 10 daysWilling to learn and apply new skills.Who would do well:People who have done well with us in the past have had experience in admin, retail, fast food, cashier, administrative assistant, receptionist, office work, server, landscaping, and in just about any field you can imagine. We welcome all applicants who have a positive attitude and enjoy working with people.This entry level sales position is a great fit for people who are looking for part time or a full time opportunity. If you looking for summer work or just someone who is looking for a flexible schedule, our opportunities can work around your needs.If you think you would be a great fit for our sales team fill out the contact information and a receptionist will follow up with you about setting up a virtual interview with a manager. We encourage applicants of all ages and experience, as we do not discriminate on the basis of an applicant’s age.

title: Member Service Representative II
description_text: DescriptionPOSITION SUMMARY: Assists members in establishing memberships, share and loan accounts, and related products and services by conducting interviews, completing necessary documents and performing data entry of records in compliance with audit requirements. Processes transactions for members and frequently serves as the initial point of contact between the Credit Union and the members. Promotes optimal member engagement by providing specific, accurate and timely information to members regarding Credit Union products and services.Responsible for educating members regarding current marketing promotions, for engaging new members to become Signature Members within their first 120 days of joining the Credit Union, and for engaging existing members to deepen their product and service usage with the Credit Union. Completes applications for equity products and makes referrals for insurance services, investment services and first mortgage real estate services.ESSENTIAL POSITION FUNCTIONS:Consistently provides a high level of service and is committed to increasing member satisfaction. Demonstrates adherence to the Branch Service and Signature Experience Standards in addition to enforcement and modeling of our Mission Statement, Core Values and Team Attributes. Promotes advocacy and takes personal responsibility to ensure that member issues are handled properly at the first point of contact. Focuses on delivering Signature Experiences and achieving successful results in the Member Experience Surveys.Maintains knowledge of products and services. Performs day to day transactions for members including, but not limited to deposits, withdrawals and transfers. Answers member inquiries and provides information in accordance with Credit Union policies and procedures for statement requests, stop payments, fraud claims, insurance of accounts, and other deposit account-related needs. May participate in the servicing of ATM coin and cash machines.Processes applications for consumer loan products, including but not limited to auto loans, credit cards, share secured loans and unsecured lines of credit. May also process applications and fundings for home equity loans and lines of credit. Serves as a member advocate throughout the loan process. Funds loans and provides basic credit review counseling for members with declined loans. Assists members with savings products, including checking and certificate accounts, money market accounts and Individual Retirement Accounts. Remains proficient in the legal aspects of accounts (e.g. trusts, fiduciary accounts, Power of Attorneys, etc.). Provides service as Notary Public.Targets and achieves individual goals and supports branch goals. Contributes to Wescom growth through needs-based sales and service skills to match services to member needs. Ensures optimal member engagement and a migration to appropriate delivery channels. Makes referrals for insurance services and investment services to Wescom Insurance Services and Wescom Financial Services. Takes applications for home equity products and makes referrals for first mortgages to Mortgage Loan Originators in Real Estate.Meets personal development and training objectives. Achieves core curriculum and required training within establish timeline. Completes Wescom University core curriculum, including required regulatory training. Mentors other team members in skill development.The expectation is that this position is a career path to MSR III which requires the following licensing:MSR III - Option I: An MSR licensed to assist members with life insurance and fixed annuities in conjunction with Wescom Financial Services (WFS).Option II: An MSR licensed to assist members with property and casualty insurance products in conjunction with Wescom Insurance Services (WIS).The progression should occur within 120 days as a guideline. This timeline could vary.Maintains proficiency in technology applications across all channels including the operating system and ancillary systems. Actively promotes and demonstrates technology to members. Contributes to organizational efforts in process improvement.Ensures branch compliance with audit and security standards, policies and procedures, and loss prevention measures. Maintains confidentiality of Credit Union and member records.Protects the Credit Union’s financial interest by controlling and balancing assigned cash drawer, negotiable items received and disbursed during daily transactions, identifying payees, verifying signatures and endorsements, and maintaining Teller Balancing Standards.Communicates well both verbally and in writing, effectively shares information and ideas with others, and demonstrates good listening skills.Must have effective human relations skills in order to maintain positive and productive working relationships with others.Ensures individual appearance reflects the desired level of professionalism. Maintains the physical environment of the branch according to Wescom standards.Maintains good attendance and punctuality in adherence with Wescom policy.EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: High School graduate.Previous financial industry and customer service experience preferred.REGISTRATION:Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System (NMLS) registration is required and must be maintained. Maintain licensing as Notary Public.COMPUTER SKILLS:Proficient in Microsoft applications (Word, Excel, Outlook). Must be proficient in technology applications including the Credit Union’s operating system and specialized software required for performance of position.MATHEMATICAL SKILLS:Ability to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals. Ability to compute rates, ratios and percentages.PHYSICAL DEMANDS:The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger; handle or feel; reach with hands and arms, climb or balance, stoop kneel, crouch, crawl; talk; hear; and smell. The employee must occasionally left and/or move up to 25 pounds. Vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.WORK ENVIRONMENT:The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing functions of this job.The noise level in the work environment is moderately quiet. It is a non-smoking environment.The above job requirements are representative of minimum levels of knowledge, skills, and abilities. The marginal functions have not been included. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.This job description in no way implies that these are the only duties to be performed. An employee will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and duties as requested by the supervisor and/or management.

title: Operator - Chemical Manufacturing
description_text: DescriptionWe are Hiring!Essential business has an immediate need for an experienced Chemical operator. As an Operator in our Specialty Chemical Manufacturing Plant, you are responsible for monitoring the plant equipment that processes chemicals from raw materials to finished goods.  The Chemical Operator oversees the safe handling and storage of chemicals, logs data and records production activities.  The plant operate 24 hours x 365 days a year and requires a Rotating Shift with shift differential.  We are an essential business providing products for our global customers.  Scheduling interviews now. Requirements/ Job Duties:2+ years’ experience as a Chemical Operator working in a chemical manufacturing plant or petroleum refiningFollow safety procedures at all timesExperience in a facility conducting batch or continuous chemical synthesis using hazardous chemicalsExperience working with raw materials, intermediates and finished goods – solids, liquids, gasesExperience monitoring chemical processing equipment including agitated reactors, heat exchanges, various types of pumps, distillation and cooling towersExperience working with proper instrumentation to take samples and conduct laboratory tests and record results like pH, temperature, water level, specific gravity and monitoring chemical processing equipment for pressure, temperature, flow and level indicationsAbility to read gauges, follow reactions remotely (control room) or locally; record and report findingsUnderstand the sequence of addition of reactants and reaction steps, sequence of events expected during reaction steps, required temperature, pressure, levels, and flows for proper processing to occurBe able to function in a crisis situation under direction of operator, supervisor or other in case of emergency in the manufacture of flammable, corrosive and highly toxic chemicalsAdditional Requirements:HS Diploma / GEDExcellent communication skillsForklift experienceRotating shift HAZMAT training - 40 hr preferredComputer skills: Microsoft Word and ExcelOther: Must be able to pass physical and background check if offered the positionAMVAC’s Benefits:• Shift differential $$• Exceptional Health Insurance including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life • 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan with employer matching & Employee Stock Purchasing Plan • Vacation & Paid Holidays AMVAC® Chemical Corporation has successfully served the results-driven global markets through development, manufacturing and marketing products for agricultural and commercial use. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity in our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Bank Secrecy Act High Risk (KYC) Manager
description_text: DescriptionSterling Bank & Trust is financially strong and your go-to bank for trusted financial advice and services. Since 1984, we have grown from a single branch to 30 branch locations in four major metropolitan markets: San Francisco, Los Angeles, New York, and Seattle.Rated excellent by the prestigious BauerFinancial, we have also been ranked in the top 50 American banks by Forbes Magazine in its annual “Best Publicly Traded Banks” survey which measures the performance of nearly 600 institutions. We are also ranked in the top 10 percent in two critical financial categories: return on average assets and return on equity.Sterling was named the top-performing community bank in the United States two years in a row with total assets between $3 billion and $10 billion in 2018 and with assets between $1 billion and $10 billion in 2017 respectively by S&P Global Market Intelligence.We have an exciting opportunity for a Bank Secrecy Act High Risk (KYC) Manager!SUMMARYSterling Bank is seeking an experienced BSA / KYC Manager that will be primarily responsible for the management and administration of all aspects of the Bank’s High Risk Customer Due Diligence Program and manage the day to day activities of the Bank’s High Risk / KYC Team.QUALIFICATIONSTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE• Experience with applicable laws, rules and regulations pertaining to Bank Secrecy Act, USA PATRIOT Act, FFIEC Examination Manual, and FinCEN’s CDD Final Rule.• Maintain an in-depth knowledge of client on-boarding data and document requirements as required by the Bank’s BSA Policy.• Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university; and 5 years or more related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.• BSA / KYC management experience required.HERE ARE JUST SOME OF THE BENEFITS YOU’LL ENJOY:•Full Benefits; Dental, Medical, Vision•Paid time off and holidays•401K Plan with Employer MatchFor more information and to apply for this position candidates should apply online.EOE Minorities/Women/Disabled/VetsVEVRAA Federal Contractor

title: Registered Dietitian - Los Angeles CA
description_text: Description   If you are passionate about providing world-class customer service and would like to grow your career with an industry-leading company, we may have just the position for you!        Shield Healthcare is currently seeking an enthusiastic, career-minded Registered Dietitian Sales Representative to support our Santa Fe Springs Sales office. We   value the vital role of the Registered Dietitian, who provides a great patient and customer experience that results in the continued growth of our Enteral Nutrition Support Program.         Job Summary      As a Registered Dietitian Sales Representative, you will develop and maintain professional relationships with customers, referral sources and vendors.  You will work with physicians and referral sources regarding the patient’s nutritional needs.  You will educate families, caregivers, and patients on how to safely tube feed at home. Using your clinical nutrition expertise, you will function as an integral part of the patient’s care team while working to maximize revenue potential in key accounts.           Salary & Benefits      Base salary (based on experience) PLUS commission AND car allowance   Medical, Dental and Vision (Eligible first day of employment)   Flexible Spending Account   Life & Disability Insurance   401(k)   Vacation, Personal, and Sick Days   Paid Holidays   Education Assistance   Employee Discounts              Key Job Responsibilities include:      Working in conjunction with the Shield Sales Representative to maximize enteral sales potential in the territory.    As a subject matter expert, provide recommendations, develop, test and implement nutrition education tools to be used in the field   Work with Sales and Marketing teams to increase Enteral business   Work on outreach efforts to increase community knowledge of the SHC Enteral program   Participate in community events and health fairs         Experience/Qualifications/Education:    Current Registered Dietitian licensure   Minimum 2 years’ experience as a Registered Dietitian   Excellent communication and interpersonal skills   Ability to sell a service and promote a product line   Ability to travel   Computer literate          Preferred Qualifications:      Experience with enteral patients       Company Overview     Since 1957, Shield Healthcare has provided high-quality healthcare services while focusing on customer satisfaction and employee achievement. We are dedicated to fulfilling the medical supply needs of consumers and the caregiving community while maintaining a 99% overall customer satisfaction rating.

title: Associate Scientist
description_text: DescriptionSeeking an Associate Scientist! Description:The Associate Scientist will be primarily responsible for executing multi parametric flow cytometry based immunophenotyping, analysis of the data and its organization and presentation.Additional Responsibilities: Execute flow cytometry experiments during analytical method development for QC release and characterization of cell therapy products Conduct multicolor flow cytometry experiments to enable routine and non-routine analysis of cellular products Perform flow cytometry based analytical method development and qualification to enable product characterization of autologous T cell therapies Work on critical cross-functional projects with the Process Design, Research, Translational Medicine, and/or QC teams to enable manufacturing process, formulation, and drug product development of therapeutics. Conduct experiments by rigorously implementing approved protocols and following good documentation practices Execute and document cell culture and passaging and banking activities as required Plan and execute assigned experiments that support routine development activities	and project goals. Analyze, interpret, and present experimental data, and carefully document resultant information. Author and review method development reports, test methods and SOPs. Systematically record data and analyze the results of laboratory operations to ensure compliance to appropriate test methods, specifications, and protocols. Participate in analytical method transfer activities to clinical and commercial Participate in meetings, present data, provide expertise in areas of responsibility and analyze and prepare data for sharing Operate and troubleshoot laboratory instrumentation that is used routinely in execution of assays Support testing as needed to enable process development, innovation and investigations Ensure that departmental work areas are maintained per 5S guidelines	 Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Biology, Immunology, Molecular Biology or related discipline with 8+ years of industry experience, or advanced degree (MS) in relevant discipline with 6+ years of industry experience Experience with multi-color flow cytometry technology and associated instrumentation required Knowledge and experience in flow cytometry data analysis using FACSDiva, FlowJo and other relevant softwares Experience in cell sorting is a plus Knowledge of mammalian cell culture including primary T cells Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office, data analysis software (e.g. Prism, JMP) and other applications Ability to think critically and demonstrate troubleshooting and problem solving skills Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and willing to accept temporary responsibilities outside of initial job description Experience and aptitude in working in a multidisciplinary laboratory environment with moderate supervision Comfortable in a fast-paced small company environment with minimal directionFor consideration please email most up-to-date resume with contact information to Brittany Waldron @ bwaldron@apexsystems.com#LI-BW4EEO EmployerApex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystemsinc.com or 844-463-6178.

title: Systems Administrator Sr.- South Pole, Antarctica (Austral Summer/Winter 2020-2021)
description_text: DescriptionJob purposeThe System Administrator Senior position performs critical IT activities in support of the users. This position is responsible for the administration, maintenance and troubleshooting of all servers, network operating systems, backup systems and production database servers. This position ensures that all systems meet the program standards for the production environments.Duties and responsibilitiesDirect role in data center operations & backup management.Supports the backup management application.Server asset (Physical & Virtual) management.Backup, restore monitoring & troubleshooting.Work with engineers to diagnose and repair hardware problems in lab environments.Document and communicate status, procedures, and plans.All other duties as assigned.QualificationsBachelor's degree in computer science or related field. 6 years of experience.Microsoft Windows Server experience required.Microsoft Exchange Server experience required.VMware server experience required.Basic networking Windows and MS Office knowledge is a must.Ability to lift 25 lbs.Excellent English communication skills both written and verbal.Documentation writing skills.Ability to prioritize tasks.Ability to work both independently with little supervision and in a team environment.U.S. citizenship or permanent residence is required.CompetenciesTechnical Capacity.Organizational Skills.Strategic Thinking.Problem Solving/Analysis.Physical requirementsDeployment will be required in this position. In addition to the completion of a compatibility face to face interview, the individual in the position must successfully complete the physical and dental examinations as required by the NSF for deploying to Antarctica.  Failure to meet these requirements may result in withdrawal of employment offer or other employment action. Complies with applicable safety, environment, health, and waste management policies and procedures.              Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.   Position ExpectationsThis is a full-time, seasonal position located in Antarctica.All expenses paid while deployed including meals, lodging, cold-weather gear, tools, and travel to/from Antarctica.Performance Period: October 2020 - November 2021Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

title: Assistant Project Manager - Construction
description_text: DescriptionAssistant Project Manager – Luxury Residential ConstructionLos Angeles, CA If you are looking for an exciting opportunity to work on the top residential construction projects being built on the West Coast, you may qualify for a rewarding career at Hill Construction Company.  We are currently looking to add an Assistant Project Manager (APM) to our dynamic Los Angeles team.The Company Hill Construction Company sets the standard in luxury homebuilding, combining highly skilled craftsmanship with progressive technical expertise. With jaw-dropping projects being built in Los Angeles, Orange County, Palm Desert and San Diego, we collaborate with the area’s most elite and celebrated architects and designers.  Our homes are consistently showcased in national and regional magazines including dwell, luxe, Interiors, California Homes, and more.  Continual advancement, uncompromised quality and passion for excellence have led Hill Construction to win numerous industry awards and accolades. Please learn more about us by visiting www.hillconstructioncompany.com and exploring our Instagram, Facebook and Houzz pages.BenefitsFull time employee benefits include health and dental insurance, Paid Time Off, 401k retirement plan with employer matching, cell phone reimbursement, fuel reimbursement and potential year-end bonus. We pride ourselves on our company culture – one in which every employee has the opportunity to collaborate, contribute and help shape the future of our growing corporation.OverviewAs an industry leader, Hill Construction excels in making the most technical projects look effortless and turning a dream into a home. In order to continue growing and servicing our clients, our Los Angeles team is looking to add a qualified and enthusiastic full-time Assistant Project Manager (APM). The APM is a critical component of our winning team structure working alongside Project Managers and Superintendents on various custom construction projects. APMs are responsible for the management of project documentation and helping ensure quality and contractual risk management throughout the project life cycle.  Responsibilities Hill Construction Project Managers and Assistant Project Managers team up, alongside the Superintendent, to manage all areas of the construction process. Day-to-day responsibilities of the APM include:Bidding / EstimatingBudgetingRFI ManagementSubcontract ManagementPurchase Order ManagementShop Drawing ManagementChange Order ManagementProject Billing Review/ApprovalRisk Management and ForecastingSubmittal and Procurement ManagementQualificationsBachelor Degree (Construction Management, Engineering, or related field)1-2 years minimum direct experience with project schedules, RFIs, estimates, budgets, contractsAbility to read/bid construction plansComprehensive knowledge of subcontractor scopesAbility to clearly and effectively communicate with project owners, architects and our office teamComputer proficiency (Microsoft Office, Management Software)P6/On-Center/Revit/Bluebeam experience a plusSage/Timberline experience a plusWillingness to regularly visit and walk jobsites as well as work in the officeCandidate must possess Hill Construction’s core values: passion, integrity, hard work and professionalismAbility to sit and/or stand for extended periods, walk jobsites with ease, and bend/stoop as needed. Ability to lift or maneuver boxes without accommodationHow to ApplyPlease apply by forwarding your resume and cover letter to: careers@hillconstructioncompany.com

title: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing Services
description_text: DescriptionJob Title:: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing ServicesLocation: Southern California – Los Angeles County, Orange County, San Diego County Job Summary::We are seeking individuals who can have an immediate impact on Trinus’ and our client’s business. Someone who likes to provide stellar staffing solutions that deliver topline and bottom-line benefits to businesses. Your efforts affect not only the day to day operations of the company, but shape our future. We are relatively small today, so there is opportunity for learning and room for rapid advancement. We work collaboratively and help each other and value people that like to get stuff done. Because Trinus’ bonus and rewards program will recognize your accomplishments and achievements that may go unnoticed in a larger organization. The Business Development Manager will be responsible for developing new client relationships, selling our IT staffing services by identifying new business opportunities, maintain and grow single or multiple accounts, partner with the Recruiting team, and meet Trinus’ business objectives and goals. Professional Experience::Minimum of 3 years of IT staffing experience in account management and recruiting rolesExperience working at enterprise-level (large accounts) and SME accountsProven success in identifying, shepherding and closing new staffing opportunitiesProven track record of meeting/exceeding account development quotasProven ability to manage executive-and-manager-level client relationships, engage in proposal development, present solution alternatives and manage client expectationsProven ability to network and navigate through complex organizations Personal Attribute and Characteristics Entrepreneurial spirit: willingness to do “whatever it takes” to achieve desired results in a “small business” s” environment; a hunter mindsetSelf-motivated, high energy with appetite for growthPresentable, savvy and fast-learning Strong interpersonal/presentation skillsMethodical and process-oriented individual with strong follow-through habits and negotiation skillsSkilled in building trust-based relationshipsCommitment to professionalism and ethicsScope & ResponsibilityEstablish productive, professional relationships with key client personnel in assigned accounts Proactively assess, clarify, and validate client needs on an ongoing basisExpand relationships with client accounts by frequently meeting client hiring managers at all levelsMap client accounts and build account success plansSecure new business opportunities and build a sales pipeline for assigned client accountsCreate and deliver sales presentations • Gain market share at assigned client accounts by increasing revenue and gross marginsNegotiate bill rates with client managersEffectively manage and prioritize a high volume of requisitions, interviews and feedbackClearly communicate client requirements to the recruiting teamManage client SLAs, resolve issues, provide periodic reports, and track and measure progressClearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholdersMeet sales targets for profitable sales volume and strategic objectives in assigned accounts for business development Education Bachelor’s degree requiredMBA or other advanced degree a plusCompensationBase + performance-based bonuses + incentives. Full benefits including medical, dental, life insurance, 401(k), and paid vacation. Excellent growth prospects for the right candidates!To Apply:Please email resumes to sanjana@trinus.com to be a part of a high-growth professional services firm where you can take your career to new heights. Apply if you’re even slightly curious about an opportunity to take your career to the next level. Company Profile ::Trinus Corporation is a leading provider of technology solutions and services. With over two decades of experience, we enable our clients gain competitive advantage and superior business outcomes through cutting-edge, data-driven digital transformation solutions. We pride ourselves on our can-do attitude and our ability to offer the right combination of people, process, technology and innovation to cost-effectively meet our clients’ business objectives. Trinus’ data management, business intelligence & analytics, IoT, IT consulting services, cloud management, staffing and managed services are delivered through an appropriate combination of onsite, onshore and offshore capabilities. Trinus has delivered its consulting services to organizations of all sizes in the life sciences, healthcare, consumer products, entertainment, technology, manufacturing, financial services, retail, and government verticals. Trinus is headquartered in Pasadena, CA and an offshore presence in India. We are a WBE/MBE/SBE/SDB firm certified by WBENC, NMSDC and SBA

title: Associate Director, Branded Content & Strategy
description_text: DescriptionEntravision Communications CorporationJob Title: Associate Director, Branded Content & StrategyLocation/Market: Los Angeles, CAJOB DESCRIPTION Pulpo is the leading US Hispanic digital media solution provider that enables brand to connect with Hispanic audiences. As part of the Entravision Comunications family, Pulpo provides advertisers a full suite of digital offerings that include data-driving audience targeting, robust digital products, and engaging content and branded solutions. Reporting to the Senior VP of Digital National Sales, the Associate Director, Branded Content & Strategy will play a crucial role in ideating and activating compelling content that aligns with advertiser objectives while leveraging the full range of content assets of Pulpo and Entravision.Essential Job Responsibilities: Manage incoming RFPs and new business opportunities with regard to branded content proposals.Assist in the ideation of unique, original and best-in-class branded content campaigns that align with company O&O properties, personalities, social influencers and the advertiser’s goals. Your ideas will run the gamut from video, to digital articles, to radio, to experiential and beyond.Craft a content strategy for each pitch that suits an advertiser’s objectives and Pulpo’s sales and marketing response, to deliver a thoughtful, dynamic content solution.Ensure an effective handoff to productions teams once a program is sold, while remaining in background on the program to help problem-solve and keep program strategically on pointInterface with internal teams and clients throughout the campaigns as well as for new business opportunities.Represent Pulpo at client meetings and effectively communicate the team’s content ideas to clients in live pitchesManage client relationships and drive the follow up for future branded content marketing programsEnsure that market intelligence is received, analyzed, and utilized in recommending and initiating approaches, which capitalize on market opportunities and trendsCultivate close relationships with sales, product and content teams as well as other key divisions. Required Qualifications:5-7 years of experience in content marketing or related disciplines for media company,Strategic thinker with experience crafting emotional but also high-converting storytellingPrevious experience collaborating with cross-functional teams.Experience in campaign development and working with agencies.Experience working in fast-paced start-up environment with little supervisionExperience working on branding efforts or integrated marketing campaigns  Bonus pointsPrevious experience developing Hispanic, multicultural branded content solutionsExperience working within the auto, CPG, entertainment or retail industriesExperience developing 360 campaigns that integrate digital channel plus radio assets Position Type/Expected Hours of WorkThis is a full time position. Actual hours and schedule may vary. Supervisory ResponsibilityReports directly to Senior VP Digital National Sales & Business Development, Pulpo Other DutiesPlease note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Entravision Communications Corporation participates in the E-Verify system operated by the US Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration and will use E-Verify to confirm work eligibility for all new hire employees.Entravision Communications is an Equal Opportunity Employer.We encourage women and minorities to apply.
